result.execSummary:
The defendant Jessica A Drover was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
1:30 p.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by the Court - informs the defendant that she was released from jail accidentally and was to return to jail and DOC has a warrant for her arrest.  Defendant requests to continue without counsel.  Court instructs defendant of his/her right to counsel.  Defendant waives right to counsel.  Court accepts waiver.  Defendant has not received the revocation packet.  Court adjourns for defendant to read the packet.

Court adjourned at 1:33 p.m.

1:54 p.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by defendant - requests to proceed without counsel.  Defendant has received a copy of the revocation packet, with no corrections, additions or deletions.  State has received a copy of the revocation packet, with no corrections, additions or deletions.  Sentencing statement by DA Christenson.  Statement by defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

EACH (Count 1 & Count 2)

Ct 1 - 30 days county jail.  Sentence is to commence immediately.  Court grants huber, out-of-county service and out-of-county travel.
Ct 2 - 6 months county jail.  

Jail sentences are to be concurrent to each other and consecutive to any other.

Court grants 101 days of sentence credit.

Court orders the court costs of $443 & $443 be reduced to a civil judgment.

Court adjourned at 2:01 p.m.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on July 25, 2017 at 01:00 pm.

11:11 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Max Saylor.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Saylor - may be a potential conflict of interest, but believes that we can proceed.  Court questions defendant - requests to proceed with Atty Saylor.  No objection by DA.  DA recites agreement, will amend count 2 to misdemeanor bail jumping and defendant will plea to both counts.  Atty Saylor concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 as charged and count 2 as amended.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Saylor.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to: 

Counts 1 & 2 (BOTH)

SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 2 years, concurrent with any other probation sentence.

CONDITIONS(EACH):

-Court costs.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court adjourned at 11:20 a.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 21, 2016 at 11:00 am.

10:00 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Max Saylor.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Saylor - requests an adjournment to end of June.  Court sets for plea & sentencing on June 21, 2016 at 11:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 10:00 a.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 10, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 3, 2016 at 10:00 am.

2:02 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Max Saylor.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Saylor - defendant is to be scheduled in FDL next week and 04/25 in Waushara County case and requests another adjournment.  Court sets for plea & sentencing on May 3, 2016 at 10:00 A.M.

Court adjourned at 2:04 p.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 03-15-2016 02:00 pm

9:12 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Max Saylor.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Saylor, a presentence investigation is currently being completed and is requesting an adjournment.  No objection by DA Christenson.  Court sets for Plea & Sentencing on March 15, 2016 at 2:00 P.M.
 
Court adjourned at 9:13 A.M.
Status hearing at 02-22-2016 09:00 am
Status hearing at 01-11-2016 08:30 am

9:13 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Max Saylor.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by the Court.  Statement by Atty Saylor - Fond du lac County case is not resolved and is scheduled for 12/22.  Further statement by Atty Saylor - defendant will waive the preliminary hearing.  Defendant concurs.  Court instructs the defendant regarding her right to a preliminary examination.  Defendant waives her right to a preliminary examination.  Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial.

State files an information with the court.  Attorney Saylor and defendant acknowledge receipt of the information and waives any reading.  Atty Saylor enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant.  Court sets for Status Hearing on January 11, 2016 at 8:30 a.m.  

Court adjourned at 9:16 a.m.
Status hearing at 11-30-2015 09:00 am

9:05 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Max Saylor.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Saylor.  Court sets for Status Hearing on November 30, 2015 at 9:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 9:06 a.m.

ADDRESS INFO for Jessica A Drover
Current: 451 Dartford Rd, Berlin, WI 54923 United States  (Effective: 09-22-2015)
Prior: 187 Eastridge Dr Unit 1, Berlin, WI 54923
Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.
Status hearing at 10-12-2015 09:00 am
Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

8:58 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Max Saylor.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Saylor confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond and conditions of:  Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.  Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives the time limits.  Court will set for Status Hearing on October 12, 2015 at 9:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 9:00 a.m.
By Atty Max Saylor
